oai_dc:dc.dc:title: "The German Singing Society's Concert and Ball"
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: German Singing Society; Joliet, Illinois; Walser, F.;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: "Our German friends last evening had a very pleasant time at Theiler's Hall on the West side, where a concert and ball was given under the auspices of the Joliet Sangerbund. This society, which is one of the most flourishing German organizations in the city, has recently admitted ladies to its membership and a number of them took part at last night's concert. The affair last night was under the management of a committee consisting of Albert Roos, of the Joliet Herold, Gallus Mueller, chief clerk of the Illinois State Penitentiary, and F. Walser, who was also musical director and is a gentleman of high musical culture..."
